thread.title: Police looking for missing diver in Marlborough Sounds find body
thread.title_full: Police looking for missing diver in Marlborough Sounds find body

author: JEFFREY KITT
title: Police looking for missing diver in Marlborough Sounds find body
text:
Police looking for missing diver in Marlborough Sounds find body JEFFREY KITT Last updated 13:52, February 28 2017 SCOTT HAMMOND/FAIRFAX NZ 
The Marlborough Coastguard assisted in the search for a diver near Stephens Island on Saturday. 
A body has been found following an extensive search for a diver who went missing in the Marlborough Sounds. 
A 49-year-old man was reported overdue about 10.20am on Saturday after he failed to resurface from a dive north of Stephens Island, the northern-most point of the Marlborough Sounds. 
The National Dive Squad found a body on Tuesday. SUPPLIED 
Stephens Island in the Marlborough Sounds, north of d'Urville Island. 
READ MORE: * Search ongoing for diver in the Marlborough Sounds 
A police spokeswoman said formal identification of the body was yet to take place and no further details were available until then. 
Emergency services and Marlborough fishermen assisted in the search on Saturday, with one boat finding a fin in the water. 
MORE TO COME.
